PSMB8 encodes a catalytic subunit of the 20S immunoproteasomes called beta5i. Immunoproteasome-mediated proteolysis generates immunogenic epitopes presented by major histocompatibility complex (MHC) class I molecules
the genetic variant within the LMP2/LMP7 gene would increase the risk of intestinal M. tuberculosis infection.

In patients with primary Sjogren's syndrome, the expression of LMP7 (but not LMP2) is up-regulated in the labial gland.

we identified two single nucleotide polymorphisms within the beta5i/LMP7-encoding gene sequences, which were in strong linkage disequilibrium, as independent genetic risk factors for type 1 diabetes development in humans

CANDLE syndrome is caused by mutations in PSMB8, a gene recently reported to cause "JMP" syndrome in adults.

The results show that PSMB8 exon 2 SNP is significantly associated with vitiligo.

PSMB8 rs2071464 was associated with generalized and active vitiligo from Gujarat whereas TAP1 rs1135216 showed no association. The down-regulation of PSMB8 in patients with risk genotype 'CC' advocates the vital role of PSMB8 in the autoimmune basis of vitiligo.
results suggest that PSMB8 is a predictive marker of preoperative radiosensitivity in locally advanced rectal cancer patients.

The present study illustrated that the carriage of LMP7 rs2071543-AA and TAP2 rs1800454-AA had a negative effect on treatment response to pegIFN-alpha/RBV among genotype 1 patient with chronic hepatitis C (CHC) in a Chinese Han population

This is the first study to report that the heterozygous LMP2 R/C and homozygous C/C genotypes increase susceptibility to ESCC in the Kazakh population and that the heterozygous LMP7 Q/K genotype decreases susceptibility to ESCC in this population
PSMB8 is closely associated with migration, proliferation, and apoptosis of glioma cells.
Study identified PSMB8 as a specific biomarker for mucinous ovarian carcinoma (MuOC) as it is strongly expressed in MuOC but not in the serous type samples.

Results found that 40% of breast tumors show high level of LMP7 expression with more tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes (TILs) and correlated with better disease-free survival outcomes than those with no or low expression in the lymphatic metastasis group. These results indicate that better antigen presentation through greater LMP7 expression might be associated with more TILs in breast cancer.

summary: The proteasome is a multicatalytic proteinase complex with a highly ordered ring-shaped 20S core structure. The core structure is composed of 4 rings of 28 non-identical subunits; 2 rings are composed of 7 alpha subunits and 2 rings are composed of 7 beta subunits. Proteasomes are distributed throughout eukaryotic cells at a high concentration and cleave peptides in an ATP/ubiquitin-dependent process in a non-lysosomal pathway. An essential function of a modified proteasome, the immunoproteasome, is the processing of class I MHC peptides. This gene encodes a member of the proteasome B-type family, also known as the T1B family, that is a 20S core beta subunit. This gene is located in the class II region of the MHC (major histocompatibility complex). Expression of this gene is induced by gamma interferon and this gene product replaces catalytic subunit 3 (proteasome beta 5 subunit) in the immunoproteasome. Proteolytic processing is required to generate a mature subunit. Two alternative transcripts encoding two isoforms have been identified; both isoforms are processed to yield the same mature subunit. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
